greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows of coefficients of polynomials P[n](x) defined by P[0]=0, P[1]=x+1; for n >= 2, P[n]=(x+1)*P[n-1]+x*P[n-2].
comment: A variant of A008288 (they satisfy the same recurrence).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
formula: P[n](x) = (x+1) * (sqrt(x)*I)^(n-1) * U[n-1](-I*(x+1)/sqrt(x)/2), where U[n](t) is Chebyshev polynomial of the 2nd kind. - _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 10 2008
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := 2^(1-n)*Binomial[n, k]*Sum[Binomial[n, 2*m+1]*HypergeometricPFQ[{-k, -m, k-n}, {1/2-n/2, -n/2}, -1], {m, 0, (n-1)/2}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 09 2014, after _Max Alekseyev_ *)
program: (PARI) { T(n,k) = sum(m=0,(n-1)\2, binomial(n,2*m+1) * sum(j=0,m, binomial(m,j) * binomial(n-2*j,k-j) * 2^(2*j+1-n) ) ) } - _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 10 2008
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 10 2007
